meanings.sent1: The craftsman will suberise the tree bark to make it into cork.
meanings.sent2: The winemaker decided to suberise the bottle stoppers for a better seal.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally suberised my shoes with cork, now they look like clogs!
meanings.sent4: Her heart seemed to suberise with cork, protecting her emotions from harm.
meanings.sent5: The magician waved his wand, and the table suberised into cork before our eyes.

meanings.definition: To cover or line with cork.
meanings.sent1: The artist will suberise the sculpture with cork for a unique texture.
meanings.sent2: The gardener decided to suberise the plant pots to keep the soil moist.
meanings.sent3: The chef tried to suberise the cake with cork, but it didn't turn out well.
meanings.sent4: The room was so quiet, you could hear a pin drop on the suberised walls.
meanings.sent5: The car enthusiast wanted to suberise the dashboard with cork for a vintage look.

meanings.sent1: Over time, the tree bark will suberise and become corky.
meanings.sent2: The old wine barrel started to suberise, showing its age.
meanings.sent3: The joke was so bad, it made everyone's faces suberise with corky expressions.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the sky seemed to suberise into a corky texture.
meanings.sent5: The once smooth surface began to suberise, feeling rough and corky to the touch.
